review: This was my first time coming to this restaurant. They asked when we arrived if we had been there before and I told them no. A little in to being there the general manager brings over a complimentary dish to welcome us.  He asked if he could bring my six year old some pizza dough to play with! What kid wouldn't love that! Food was great, service was great! Definitely made an impression and will be back!

The food and service here is excellent and it is a very family-friendly place. I came here with my infant daughter and the staff was very attentive and accommodating, helping us to get seated and even taking the time to help me with her complicated stroller! The server Michelle and manager Devon really went out of their way to make it a positive dining experience. The veggie pizza was delicious! I would definitely come here again.

Ever leave a place walking a bit funny because the bill was a bit steep and you didn't really feel like it was worth it? Well that's how I felt here.  You would think that at 11am (when they open) you would receive fast service. Well that is not the case. It took over an hour for our food to come and quite honestly it wasn't that great. The bill for 2 adults and a baby... 40 bones. Yikes...  If you have a lot of time and money to blow go here but if you're like me and look for places that deliver service and food that is worth every dime of your hard earned moolah, there are better places.

Ironically, we came here for salads. And yes, it was very hard... And took a lot of will power to watch all those pizzas go by as you order your "quinoa arugula" salad.  However, we come here for salads because they are delicious and big! You have a great selection of your 1,500 calorie ranch, bacon bit loaded salad, but also have a great selection of genuinely nutritious salads that will definitley fill you up. I got the quinoa arugula salad in the half size, and as noted it was more than enough. Get a full size if you want to make two meals out of your visit.  Delicious and nutritious!

If you are not a huge Pizza fan not to worry this incredible place will offer you something that you do like. They have a Pizza centric menu but also seafood, subs and Desserts that will make your mouth water.   They offer outside seating and the inside is spacious and modern. My Pizza was perfect and my wife's shrimp scampi passed her critical tastebuds.  Attentive service even from the manager. They do lose a point due to the difficulty of finding a parking space. All in All.  Great food. Great Service. Great Time.

Maybe my tastes are more sophisticated than they used to be. Idk. For $19.99, I expect the salmon to be stellar. It wasn't. It was mediocre. Oh well, the waitress was attentive and the restaurant seemed well managed with friendly staff.

Not as good as last time. The waitress was pleasant but it seemed to take forever to get our orders. I had the tortilla soup with half chicken sandwich lunch combo.  The soup was OK, but the sandwich was very skimpy on chicken. (I actually had to open the sandwich to verify there was any chicken there at all!) More coleslaw than meat. Also, the bread they put it on was tasty but, perhaps because of the preponderance of coleslaw, it was starting to dissolve halfway through eating it and the whole thing became very messy. It wasn't horrible, just not great and I wouldn't order this again.

California dreamin', after being here! I was so impressed by this pizza kitchen, considering I'm not a huge pizza person. The employees were super accommodating for my vegan needs and my friend's gluten-free needs. My big group of 14 people all seemed to really enjoy what they ordered. The food was really tastey. We did have to wait a little while for it, but it wasn't too long a wait.  They have wonderful salads, and the pizza crust IS vegan! They even offered up a free dessert for our friend's birthday. Good for group outings, dates, or simply lunch!

Pros: Amazingly delicious pizza and salad! Cons: The service was horrible tonight. Last time it was mediocre at best. Also the prices are too high for what you get.  I have dined here on two occasions. Once for lunch and tonight for dinner. I typically like to wait before I review a restaurant, so I did. On my first visit, I had a lunch special with the salad and pizza, and my mother ordered a sandwich and salad. Both items were superb! I had the BBQ chicken pizza and a spinach and quinoa salad, and wow super yummy! I also had the mango iced tea which was great! My mom had the turkey and Brie, and she loved it (plus the salad but I can't remember which one).  Honestly, the food was so great we wanted to return! The prices were steep (like $15 per person), but we were satisfied. The service wasn't the best, but it had slightly improved near the end so we looked past it. We figured at least the girl was kind and was able to get us what we needed.  However, in search of somewhere to eat tonight I remembered that we had a special coupon for this place, and pizza sounded good and I was in the mood for a salad.  So since my dad had missed the last trip here, we decided to bring him there! We were greeted and seated right away, and our drink orders were taken quickly. Everything seemed to be going swell, but then I had requested a water for my mom... We waited and waited, but nothing. I decided since I had ordered a drink and a water I would just give her mine and wait for the new one. Finally about 12 minutes later, I see the girl (who I won't name) coming with the water.  She sees my mom has one and returns the water to the back. At this point, she comes and takes our order. We ordered a large pizza and full salad for us to share, and again I request a water. She takes our order back and we notice the table behind us who came in 10 minutes or more after us has already received their bread. I look at the girl (as she drops off their bread) and she goes to the kitchen and about 10 minutes later comes back with bread. She profusely apologizes for the delay and claims it's late because it had just come out of the oven. I again asked for water and she takes about 3 minutes but comes back with it. I ask for a straw, but long story short I never got one (thank god I had an extra straw in my purse). The food came (I might add super fast). We got the quickest food service! It was great, but honestly this has been probably the worst restaurant service experience I have had (due to her attitude and lack of service). The experience was so bad, I don't think my review would do it justice. Honestly for $20+ a person for dinner I will take my business elsewhere and get better service. I don't care how delicious the food is.

I have eaten at this CPK more than a handful of times and I have never had a bad experience or a bad server.  The food is always good. I love their original BBQ chicken pizza & the butter cake.  I have never experienced a wait, even when it seems like it's busy. However, I am usually only here around lunch time.

Overpriced!!!  Purchased a wild mushroom pizza and chicken BBQ.  Thin sauce and toppings.  Pizza size have shrunk and toppings almost non existent.  Mushrooms shaved so thin we kept looking for them.  A restaurant past its prime cruising on its old reputation.  Never again!!!

As someone who works in the service industry, I expect without complaint, that when I visit a popular restaurant during peek hours I will likely get mediocre service and best. The food will probably also not look or taste as good as would were the cooks to have sufficient time to put a little more love in to each dish. Thus I try to avoid such establishments during these hours. But alas, at 1pm on Monday, I was almost hungry enough to eat the shoes I had just purchased next door. So, I went somewhere I'd never been with low expectations... just to put anything outside of footwear into my stomach. The place was pretty packed, so a wait would have been understandable. Yet we were sat within 2 minutes of walking in and greeted by our server, Michelle, immediately upon taking our seats. She had an obviously hefty work load, yet remained just the right amount of friendly and attentive without ever appearing overwhelmed. She was memorable and enjoyable but never over stayed her welcome at our table... there's a fine balance by my perspective, and it takes a skilled server to maintain it. She was incredibly knowledgeable of the menu and it's detailed ingredients and willing to modify it to accommodate my fancy pants taste buds. Our drinks stayed full throughout. The food arrived in a timely manner and was absolutely with out flaw. I can say without hesitation that it was officially the very best gluten free pizza I've had in Albuquerque. So good, in fact, that I was far too busy eating it, to take a picture of it. Not to worry, I'll be back! Given the quality of the food and service, it was also very reasonably priced. This was an obviously well managed restaurant with quality people cooking and serving the food. Way to go CPK... I was blown away with satisfaction.

I really hate giving one star, it takes a lot for me to rate a business so low, but California Kitchen was a real bummer.  My mom and I ate there at about 1 pm so seating was fast.  Service was what earned the low rating.  It took a loooooooong time for our server to make contact.  When he was taking our order he unfortunately sneezed all over his hands, then immediately picked up the menus.  I went to the bathroom and washed my hands... ew.  He could have apologized and excused himself to clean up before touching stuff on our table.   The food was fair, it was exactly what you'd expect from a California Kitchen anywhere.  It wasn't spectacular and wasn't bad... just mediocre chain food.  It wasn't enough to bring us back.    I noticed my water glass had a big crack in it half way through the meal and asked the server to replace the glass, when he returned, the 2nd glass had a chip on the rim.  My mother's diet coke came iced in a seriously hot glass.  I think they must be taking glasses straight out of the washer steaming hot then putting ice and cold drinks inside.  I think that was a science experiment in high school.... glass cracks... is that called thermal shock maybe?  I can't remember it's been a long time since high school. After we finished about 215 our server was nowhere to be found but he had dropped off the check.  We assumed we needed to go to the front to pay so walked up to the register.  Several employees were at the register and no one interacted with us.  We asked if we could pay and a server stated "I'm off the clock I can't touch your money."  Ok, another option would be to say, "let me find someone to assist you."  Such a strange customer service approach at this CPK.   We finally were able to pay and leave.  Kind of a bummer of an experience.  We won't be back.

This location os the very best CPK that I have been too, anywhere I California, and the funny thing is that its located in New Mexico! LOL This place looks the nicest of all CPK I have ever seen, its beautiful, perfectly maintained, has a proper sit-down restaurant look to it and is a comfortable environment to enjoy your evening in. The food is quite good and has a decent variety, with even more variety in its way, so its easy to find something for everyone. The very best part of this location is the service. This is the very best service of any CPK I have ever experienced, by far. Its more like the service in a five star restaurant. The staff is simply excellent. The Hostess greeted us with a smile, immediately welcomed us and got us to our table immediately. She made sure we were comfortable and made an effort to settle us into their lovely environment. Courtney, our waitperson, is charming, professional, kind, informative, patient and fast. We were exhausted from an all day outdoor event yesterday in one hundred degree weather. Not having seen a CPK menu in quite some time, it took a while for us to figure out what we wanted. To make it worse, we were so spent from all those ours in eh heat and sun that our brains just could not process the menu quickly yet Courtney patiently helped us muddle through it and gave us all the time we needed to get through it. Having just moved to New Mexico and getting lost on the way to Uptown, Courtney made us feel welcome to this State as well as to CPK. She exemplifies how service should be offered at a four and five star restaurant, and she sets the bar si very high for CPK. We intend on asking for her by name each time we visit CPK. She's that good. Courtney brought the dinner out so quickly I thought that I had just barely blinked my eye and her sunny smile was once again at our table, cheerfully serving and making sure that we were comfortable. The Garlic Cream Fettuccini was quite good and enjoyable as was the "Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler" (Fresh strawberries hand-shaken with Fresca and Monin South Seas, featuring natural flavors of mango, guava and ginger. Lite in calories too!), although it was a bit on the sweet side, it was definitely refreshing and the strawberries tasted like they came right out of the garden. This location has elevated CPK to the fine dining level, offering popular, yummy, meals. I you have not tried CPK do start with the BBQ chicken pizza, yes that really is a California thing (it was started in Los Angeles) and truly is quite tasty, but no matter which dish you go there for, you'll enjoy the excellent service environment that the manager of this location has created for you, he and his staff are to be commended on the excellence of their demeanor and service delivery which is what earned them five stars. Oh yes, there really is a Pokemon living in the outdoor seating area, he's rather friendly and is a good catch.

California Dreamin... Love this place! Great,bright,fun,friendly atmosphere. They are located in the uptown shopping center which is nice especially on those summer days taking a stroll shopping. It's nice to pop in for a quick lunch or beverage. I've never tried any of their fancy drinks but they look delicious!! I usually order the peach tea with easy syrup because sometimes they pump so much that all you taste is straight sugar. Food wise, I've always stuck to the same two things which is the California veggie pizza and the veggie sandwich which both are great choices!! I need to venture off and try one of their salads next time. My favorite part of this place is the patio. In the warm summer months it's beautiful to sit outside and people watch while enjoying a great meal! They also have these awesome two parking spots in the back of the building that when you call in your order you can park there and they will run it out. It's nice because the parking at uptown is instant stress. Cars everywhere backing in and out, people fighting for spots it gets quite crazy sometimes.  Well I'll be back very soon now that the sun is back on our side. :)

Please note: if you choose to sit outside and plan on convo do not sit by the main walkway since the Uptown speakers are directly beside and Loud! I kno the sayin goes that if ur too loud ur too old, however my 9-yr old mentioned it first! Haha, service is always great tho very tentative and the salad selection is outta this World!

Oh no California Pizza Kitchen tonight for the first time I realized why you only have a 3 star rating.... And that makes me sad.... Where shall I start??? How about with the service that's always a good starting point- well to be brutally honest the service was awful. It all started when the server went to seat us and I asked to sit some where else, I like to sit off to the side in a quite spot where my almost 2 year old isn't going to disturb other people but the server seemed put out by my request.... Sorry for been considerate didn't realize that was a bad thing :/  The second server failure was when our food arrived and we got the wrong pizza :/ so while everyone was tucking into there food my husband had to sit and watch and wait ok so mistakes happen I guess. The manager was great at following up kudos there. Your lack of thought on getting refills was just another example of the lack of service and having to wait a ridiculous amount of time to pay was just the icing on the cake.  Onto the food well it was just sub par nothing special, I usually over eat at CPK because the food is to delicious to pass up on another slice and an other and an other ok so you get the point, but tonight not so much 2 slices and I was done the flavor just wasn't there and the pizza was soggy. Overall this was an experience I regret spending $40 on and there is nothing more I hate then coming home with an empty wallet and feeling nauseous into the mix.... I am not sure if I can look past this experience and return, maybe our CPK journey is over.... And that makes me sad.

Very nice lunch on a Saturday! The place was cool and clean. We were greeted immediately upon entering. We were seated right away. Our server was attentive and overall it was a great experience!  We would definitely go back!
I'm not usually a big fan of chains, but CPK is a good choice.  Tasty food, consistent, plentiful, and good service.  This location is always busy and parking at this outdoor mall can be challenging.

Sometimes I feel like the waiter forgets about my table, but then again most of the time they're busy. The food here is a tad pricey for the amount you get -- because I always end up leaving the restaurant still hungry. But, w/ that being said, their mango iced tea & the avocado spring rolls are pretty great.

Good solid pizza.  Can get whole wheat crust if you like.  I have also had the halibut as an entree which was prepared perfectly.  A good choice if pizza is not what your in the mood for and willing shell out extra dough.

We had lunch here. The place is nice. Although I the Alfredo pasta, noodles, were under cooked. My plate looked soo dry. The chicken was chewy. The plate presentation was unappetizing from the start. The tortilla soup is more of a sauce.. A thick sauce. Good service though.

Michelle provided great customer service and I and beyond grateful.  I placed and order for pick up online during lunch time around 12. For some reason the order didn't go through. She explained they didn't have my order ready and as they never received it. She said to give her 10 mins and they wound have it ready, less than 10 mins later pizza was ready (Deliciously Perfect!!!) and I was headed back to work, without running late. I will be coming back again just for the service.

Finally had California Pizza Kitchen for the first time on my last trip to Albuquerque. The service was nice and the food was good, my daughter really liked the macaroni and cheese. The portion was really big for being from the kid's menu. The lunch duo was a great deal for a 7" pizza plus salad. Also had Marble IPA on tap.

CPK, how can I say this? I was... wrong. God, I'm so embarrassed... Okay, so I'm superficial. I am, I'll admit it. I'm impulsive. It was all about the first impression and I let my... emotions... cloud my better judgement.  Will you give me another chance? During our first date, I didn't know about your fish tacos. I didn't even ask. To be fair, I was rushed. You were really sketchy and nervous, and it was awkward. I can look back on it with some perspective now, I mean it was a blind date, neither of us trusted the person that set us up, I figured you thought my Corolla was shabby so I was on the defensive... But can I just tell you: I still don't really like you, but if you make me more of those fish tacos, I'll totally compromise my better judgement. For those panko-battered nuggets of Ono heaven, drowned in your "ranchito" sauce and covered in layers of cabbage and avocado, I'd let you take advantage of me. I would, and I wouldn't have a complex the next day because you're from California so you're used to that kind of thing. And I don't know what happened, but during our second date, you were SO different. You weren't nervous or shifty, you asked me all kinds of questions, you paid attention to me, it was like I was the center of the universe and you know what? I am! So kudos, you changed! I didn't!

I was in town for work and decided to order take out and eat it at my hotel. When I arrived at the restaurant I was immediately greeted by a host and pointed to the register to order carryout. I decided on the California Club Pizza. The guy taking my order was super friendly and offered me a beverage while I waited for my pizza. It only took about 10-12 minutes to get my order and the gentleman who took it brought it right over to me. When I got back to my hotel, I was pleasantly surprised that they included some bread and olive oil with my pizza. They also put the toppings (mixed greens, avocado, and tomato) in a separate container which was nice. The pizza was very tasty and was way more than I could eat. This was my second time at CPK and I was pleased again. Definitely good pizza for a chain restaurant.
I had the roasted veggie salad. The half size is really big! Its enough for two people. It's my favorite salad, delish!  Also had a cup of the Farmer soup, very good too.

Came here after wedding dress shopping. Ordered a California club pizza and a San Pellegrino (they serve tap water) It was definitely delish. Piled high with bacon, Turkey mixed greens, turn basil and cheese. There are lots to choose from. Noise level was quiet even though there were a few tables with children; Including ours. Someone ordered a salad, another pasta, the third avocado rolls. Yum. I'll b back there is a lot to try.
Had one bad experience, but have been back several times and they made good on their promise to do better. Great food, great service.

Wow 40.00 2 pizzas 2 ice teas hmm. I tried one Slice and was not that good. Ok that's fine but when our waiter seen this nothing was offered, To remake or to make some thing new..?? Instead was offered a box and my check, I could see if it was busy but we were there at 3:30, like 10 people in the whole place.  We eat out a lot and rarely give 2 stars, but I'm finding local places treat me better and remember me most of the time. So take it as you will, have a grate day and a wonderful weekend.

We came in with 6 people and they got us seating fairly quickly during the lunch hour. Our food was great! I got the mushroom pizza with white truffle oil (per recommendation by our waitress) and was really blown away by the flavor combination! I ranked that as one of my top 3 favorites now. Our waitress was either training or being trained, but was really polite and considerate to 6 people trying to inconsistently order.

Dirty plate given in stack of appetizer plates. Server nice but not focused gave us items we didn't order. Went at 1:30 on  Weekday. :25 to get main food.  Some slimy salad leaves in salad. Food uninspired chain food. Just overall poor experience.

The food was totally awesome, server was great also. But others that expedited food messed it up big time! Forgot serving spoons, no plates for pizza, dropped it off with not even asking, "need anything else" server had to apologize 3 times, wow but great food it was! Would have been 4 star

Really friendly staff, always smiling and helpful The first time I ever went there, they hooked me up win free chips and dip. Now food, fresh and healthy if you choose right Nice sitting area outside Haven't tried any of their alcohol options, so can't comment on that Inside is buzzing with good energy

So this was my first experience, ever, at the California Pizza Kitchen, and before getting my appetizer I see a woman putting her dog back in a stroller at a nearby table. Instantly my mind drifted from my food to dog hair floating in the air. This is the first time I have ever seen a dog in a restaurant. I am from the East Coast  where you don't see things like this. If you have a problem with animals in a restaurant then this might not be for you. The other issue was a busboy was sweeping right by our table while we were eating. I really hate that. The food was amazing, especially the warm butter cake. The waitress (Genesis) was awesome, she was personable, kept our glasses full and had our meal planned time planned perfectly. All things considered it was a good experience I just couldn't get past the dog, non service dog, being in the restaurant, the atmosphere was troubling. It is up to the persons preference.
My husband likes the pizza's here. I've only tried the mahi mahi fish tacos, which I think are pretty good. Place is always clean & servers have always been great.
Solid good place...nice atmosphere and food. They've always been consistent in the few times I've been by.

I hate restaurant chains and I try to avoid them as much as possible but I was shopping in uptown and the smells this place was giving off made me want to stop in and give it a shot. I will say the pizza here is good and I really enjoyed the crust the service was also on there A game cause my drinks were filled without me asking, food came out fast, and waitress was beyond friendly. I really cant find anything negative to say about this place and will probably be back in the future.

CPK is a great place to go if you are craving something simple and delicious.  Salads, awesome. Soups, delicious. Pasta, YUM. Pizza, even better. It's a good mixture of eclectic dishes variying from italian fare to american comforts and asian twists. I've never had anything bad to eat here and it's always consistent.  It's a nice, clean restaurant. Even the bathrooms, which is a good judge on how the place is kept. The hosts/wait staff are always really nice. The only downside is that the restaurant will get slammed with customers! I believe that they do call ahead seating in case you are going on a typically busy night (F,S,S). Try the patio. It's in a nice shaded part of Uptown so you can people watch, or just enjoy the wonderful summer weather. All in all a good comfortable place to have a delicious meal!
What an overpriced disgusting chain I see the managers treat their staff like garbage that's probably why the food tastes that way too.

This place is AMAZING! We had several drinks, all which were unique and tastey.  We had the Blueberry Ginger Smash, Beehive Sangria, Cha Cha Agua Fresca, and a special Moscow Mule.  Non-Alcoholic we had the Cucumber Reviver and Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler which were SO good.  For food we had the Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti and the Wild Mushroom Pizza with White Truffel oil.  We had a good waiter despite the place being super busy.  Our favorites were the Wild Mushroom Pizza, the Beehive Sangria and Fresh Strawberry Mango Cooler.  We need one of these restaurants in Amarillo! Would recommend!

Very over priced for food I have made at home numerous times. Our bill was over $130 for 4 adults and 3 kids, and we all had water. Vegan options were limited, but they have a helpful allergen guide. Things on the menu that seem to be easily vegan are not. The food did not have anything special and the portions were drastically different. My daughter's salad was a half order and HUGEMUNGOUS and mine was the only size offered and teeny tiny.  Our waitress (it was a stressful day and I did not get her name, I am so sorry) was absolutely fantastic. She was attentive and patient.  This feels like just another chain with boring, expensive food. Would have been a 2 star but the staff was lovely.

Quickly seated; server constantly refilling drinks and checking up on the table/ her guests.  Outdoor seating available (dog friendly)  Outdoor seating shaded by umbrellas  Dog bowls available  Child seats available

California Pizza kitchen in Uptown, is a good restaurant to check out. We were shopping around Uptown shops and took the kids for lunch. They have a very simple and straight forward kids menu of the small pizza little sliders or macaroni and cheese. My man and I ordered the pizza. The appetizers and chips and salsa and old reliable. The only thing I didn't like was that the cocktails are very much water-down with sparkling water or sparkling soda. The wait service was decent and the hostess was very welcoming and they also said goodbye when we left the restaurant. The bathrooms were clean the atmosphere was clean the kitchen is open so you can see everything going on and that is very clean. So if you wanna grab something light just a nice thin crust pizza or maybe salad please go check out California pizza kitchen in Uptown

Disclaimer: One of my family members was and still is a server here. I still review restaurants based on pure quality of service and food, however. The Good: The Jamaican Jerk pizza is my absolute favorite. Sweet and spicy, with crispy bacon and delicious peppers/onions. I like to order this with extra sauce. Also, when craving pasta, I order the chicken tequila fettuccine.  There was a shift manager here a while ago by the name of Pete, and he was the best. Entertaining, accommodating, and a pleasant person overall. Sad to hear that he'd left. The Meh: Service here is a hit or miss, sadly. You get seated almost immediately, but sometimes it takes a while for someone to actually approach your table. On my most recent visit, my bf and I waited over 15 minutes before someone came to our table outside and asked, "You haven't been helped yet right?" We ended up moving inside, due to wind. My water was never refilled, and I had to request it from the manager standing by the register (what we were eating was really spicy).  I think they've also completely removed their selection of Italian cream sodas. They were one of my favorite drinks to order, particularly in peach.

I could have had steak for the price plus they automatically added a 10.00$ gratuity to our 57$ bill  needless to say it was 72$ for two pizzas a spaghetti and a child's Mac n cheese. 3.29 for a soda?????? Where is the ten $$$$$ Wtf !

As others have written this place is underwhelming and over priced. There is much better pizza in town. We had 2 pizzas that were on the small side (they only have one size) for $29.86. It may have softened the blow a little if they had been delicious, but they were dry and lifeless! Not to mention that 30/35% of the pizza was crust. We won't be back.

We were on a Trader Joe's run, and needed a little food before our shop. Stopped in Sahara, but really didn't like the look of the underdone gyro meat on the spit. So, we ended up at CPK.  The service was efficient, the beer and wine were promptly served to begin our lunch.  I opted for a petite wedge salad to start.  It was as the Donald would say, yuuuge!  And, quite tasty.  The iceberg was cold, the bleu cheese dressing was tangy, and the bacon smoky.  Good start. Husband got the pepperoni pizza. He liked it.  Give me Amore any day... I had the half sandwich (turkey and brie) with a bowl of baked potato soup.  Yum.   For a chain restaurant, it was a pleasant experience. Lots of kids in the dining room, but so well behaved! If I was in the area, I would visit again.

Clean modern place with okay food. Nothing disappointing, but also nothing to remember when it comes to the food. Our waiter was a bit odd at first, I would almost say rude. As the evening went on, he got a little friendly.

I just got a message from CPK to write another review to their "quality control" people, but I think it's just time to move on. I understand why they put sugar in crusts and offer psuedo gluten free options that run out: Frozen.

I was not impressed. I had the California fields salad, half size. It claimed to have pistachios in it but I didn't find any in my salad. What I did have was very tasty and fresh.  I was seated right away, our waiter was nice but the service was slow. It took over 30 minutes to get our meal. Unacceptable for a busy lunch place.  But the reason for 2 stars is the menu. New law requires calories to be listed next to the dish on the menu. As I was pouring over the menu looking for a low calorie option, I saw the artichoke pizza was only 190 calories. Finally, I saw that the count was for 1 slice and that each pizza has 6 slices. So the personal pizza really has over 1100 calories! Because they only listed the per slice price made me feel deceived.

Uptown isn't always an easy place to park, but the food is generally worth the hassle.  We came here for a Sunday lunch date.  I ordered a Sangria (well made!) and my husband ordered a Mojito.  Both were delicious.  The bread and oil they serve are great.  They put salt, garlic and red pepper flakes in their oil mix which makes it a unique experience.   We ordered a thin crust sausage, pepperoni and mushroom.  unfortunately this place is so loud, our waitress thought we ordered a mushroom pizza.  We were too hungry to wait for another pizza to be made. It was delicious and not too high on the weight watchers scale (this is my life right now).  The waitress was apologetic and attempted to right the wrong.  The pizza was delicious.  A nice departure from the chain delivery pizza places for sure.  Lighter fair too.   We will definitely be returning.  They have a patio area that would be great when the temperatures begin to cool.
Crappy service. 10 minutes to get drinks. Salad came after the pizza. No refills.....and being busy (which wasn't) isn't an excuse!!! Pizza wasn't bad though. Only good experience.

CPK is a family favorite. My kids love getting their own individual pizza with toppings they like and my wife and I like getting our favorites too! She gets the classic BBQ chicken or the Jamaican Jerk and I usually get the Spicy Chipotle Chicken or the BBQ chicken with pineapple and bacon... Yum!

I haven't lived near a CPK in years, so last weekend I decided to give it a try for lunch. I was so impressed by this place! My server, Morgan, provided the best service I've had in a long time. He was friendly, kind, attentive, very observant, and incredibly polite. It made my day! As a solo diner on the patio, I appreciated the wonderful service I had with him. It looked like my fellow diners received the same level of treatment. The food was quick and really delicious. I tried a sage and cheese flatbread as well as the Cobb salad. Both items were fresh and flavorful. I will definitely be returning.

Wow... The server was sluggish and rude.  Everyone around me got bread and oil and he didn't ask me if I wanted any. I also asked for water and lemon and only got water.  Initially I was going to rate this a 3 star but I got tired of waiting for the check and he never asked me if I wanted a refill.  I had to finally get up and approach him at the checkout and request my bill. I was so thirsty I asked for a to go water with lemon. He made me wait a couple of minutes and walked over slowly with no lemon just water.  My service and experience was very poor but I gave 2 stars for the food.

The first time I visited this chain was around lunch time on New Years eve, so it was rather busy and there was a wait time of 20 minutes. But we (my mom, my brother and I)  were such in good spirits after purchasing a new iphone from the Apple store near this CPK restaurant that we didnt mind the wait.  It was quite busy that day, so maybe thats why the service suffered a little bit.  Out server was a little bit confused when sitting us. Apparently he was instructed to sit us at a certain table but that table was still dirty. He quickly found us another table though. He was also quick in providing us menus and getting out drinks and taking our orders. But he was rushed and forgot to provide my brother a drinking straw and it was hard to get his attention to this minor detail.  Also I've noticed that as compared to the other CPKs Ive been to (I travel accross US alot), this chain is subpar. It was too crowded, like they tried to fit in as many tables as they can compromising the ambience of the restaurant. It was also a full house that day so it was a bit loud with too many people. Another thing is their napkins. Other CPKs use real, cloth napkins, this establishment doesn't. They use brown, recycled paper napkins, which cheapens the whole dining experience. Anyways, shortly after giving our orders (like 10-15seconds later), we decided to ask for the menu again to order a pizza in addition to out previous orders of 3 jambalaya pasta and a share appetizer of chips and spinach/artichoke dip. The server was like "okaayy.. Are you sure? If you say so," in an offensive tone implying that we are ordering too much. We missed breakfast, waking up late, and it was already 130pm so we were starving. Besides, ordering more should be good for their business, right? During the meal, it was hard to get our server's attention for drink refills. He was busy running around tables.  The food.  Chips + spinach and artichoke dip: 3stars. Chips were bland, after a sprinkle of salt, it was alright. The dip was delicious. Will probably order again. California Club pizza. 3stars. The white sauce was extremely lacking, it was dry. Fresh parmessan was grated right in front of us. The greens in top were really fresh though and the leftover remained fresh hours after taking it to go. Will most likely not order again.  Jambalaya pasta. One of my fave CPK dish. It was still good, spicy. with generous seafood toppings in the sauce. We had the freshly grated parmessan on it as well.  Overall , we will only probably go back to this restaurant again when we feel the need to fulfill our Jambalaya pasta fix again as this is the only CPK in town. :(
Great chicken tequila fettuccine. Waiter ( Jeremy ) was a right on about what was great on the menu. Service was great, food was great,and that made everything great.

I don't like pizza it's not my favorite thing in the world. If I do eat it pizza it has to be something good not just your regular pepperoni or combination pizza. The carne asada pizza blew my mind!!! Their mixed drinks are so good as well as their cauliflower Buffalo winds. Their service was awesome.

First time I've been to this location. Barbecue chicken pizza was amazing! Service was even better. Sat at the bar on a busy Saturday lunch. Bartender helped me right away and offered fresh bread before my pizza came out! Definitely will be back!

Phenomenal food, great customer service! Love, love, love their food and every time we've gone there, we've had excellent customer service. My favorites: - Pear & Gorgonzola Pizza - Miso & Shrimp Salad - Chicken Tequila Fettuccine  - Margherita Pizza - Red Velvet Cake - Strawberry Lemonade Boyfriend's favorites: - Jambalaya  - Baby Clam Linguini w/ Lemon Cream Sauce - Chicken Piccata - Strawberry Shortcake - Kiwi Lemonade Everything we've had from this CPK has been amazing.  No complaints. We've gotten to-go from here, and also dined in.  To-go service is really good (friendly, fast, and the food is always good).  Dine-in service is really good as well.  Every time I order the Miso & Shrimp Salad I always ask for regular lettuce instead of napa cabbage and they always accommodate my requests with no hesitation. Will definitely be back for more!

I'm a huge fan of pizza and we just had to try this place. It's very busy and it seems like the are pushing for volume than quality. The pizza was cold and so were the pasta dishes. The appetizers was warmer than the main dish. In all, I would pass on this place. If you want delicious pizza in Abq, go to Nicky V's

I've been here twice and had the Fish Tacos both times and they are pretty tasty,  My kids loves the pizza with pepperoni and bacon.  I also got a Mojito this time which was decent and fairly priced, although the price isn't listed on the menu, which i'm not a fan of.   The service was very good, we sat at the "counter" which I guess if it was called a Bar, my kid wouldn't be able to sit there. I'll usually pass and go to Elephant Bar but I wouldn't discourage anyone from going.

I am a fan of some good pizza!  Even though I was skeptical because this is chain restaurant and all, but let me tell you their Roasted Artichoke + Spinach with chicken was off the hook!!  I would totally go back for this!  I tried my friend's margarita's pizza and it was good but could have been juicer. I am just saying.
Citrus Adobe Margarita and the Margarita pizza were both awesome and superb service. 5 year old ate his entire pepperoni pizza.

Okay, I should probably say first that I didn't think I would enjoy CPK and my visit to their restaurant kind of backed that up.  They have lots of choices, the service is very attentive, but their pizzas really don't taste much better than the frozen ones you can buy at the grocery store.  The crust is very thin and crispy (which I usually like), but the toppings are pretty sparse and I was still hungry afterwards. Really, like I have said before in ABQ if you want a good pizza at a great price go to Dion's and if you want to pay a little more, but have a better ambiance then go to Farina's - I won't be choosing to head back to CPK any time soon.
Always friendly staff and the menu is great. The chicken chimichurri (not sure on the spelling) is fantastic!

I have no idea why this place id so popular. I did not think the food was good here, and it was cold when I finally got my plate. When I told my server she was rude and could not have cared less, i am guessing because i did not order a alcoholic drink. I have had other friend go here with similar service. I won't be going back

Found this place to be ok,You can feel the chain  vibe..pizza was ok but the place lacked local feeling..Gets packed fast on the weekend.I do like the water spouts for the kids to get wet on a hot day..

I used to love their pizza when I worked in the mall as a kid. I still enjoy a lot of their pizzas, but their pastas are usually over cooked.  As a take out joint I highly recommend the pizzas.  As a dining experience i highly recommend you eat at Bravo next door.  Our waiter was a arrogant and quite silly actually. There was a 30 min gap where we didn't see him once. I think he may have lost his self awareness and was looking for it during those 30 min. He didn't find it... The dessert push was forced, inappropriate and left us with a smile on our faces. We were laughing at how ridiculous this man was.  I would only recommend you visit this restaurant to sit back and make fun of this kid.

First time, about 6 weeks ago, we had a great experience.  So we went back today. Today, we had a lousy experience with two inedible entrees and a surly waiter and I, for one, will never darken their door again.  Hubby had looked forward to the experience; he was extremely disappointed.  Not only will he never go back, neither will my friend nor me.

My one star is for the roasted vegetable salad. I took two of these salads home the other nigh( one with shrimp & one with chicken) it was almost $40. They were boxed up beautifully, but both were so bad we hardly ate. The roasted vegetables seemed mostly frozen with the exception of a couple. Don't waste your money just get a Caesar salad or something like that. I had the pizza a while back, it was very good.

The people and the quality of the food are really pretty darn good for a chain restaurant.  We were quickly seated on a Sunday afternoon after walking through Elephant Bar and seeing every bar table needing to be bussed and no one at the front desk.  At CPK there were several people up front and they greeted and seated us immediately.  The server was training a new server and they were very nice and helpful.  We just needed to get through a few hours til dinner so didn't want to get too full, but it is never a bad time for wine, so I started there.  A decently priced sauvignon blanc (nobili) that was more like a reisling but was nice and cold went well with the asparagus and arugula salad I ordered.  My kiddo ordered the crispy macaroni and cheese, which was mac and cheese rolled in some kind of bread crumb and herb mixture and fried.  I will never find my hip bones by eating that kind of thing, but she is young and thin and she loved it.  The service was pleasant and attentive but not overwhelming.  They brought out water pretty quickly and did not seem at all put out when I told them we just wanted a small bite.  The environment is kid-friendly (as in loud and bright) but it was remarkably tasty, especially for food you find at a mall.
BBQ chicken pizza was great. Friend hot the Chipotle pizza and was excellent. Another friend got the Thai salad and thought it was very good. Patio area is nice for beautiful day.

So many people love this place, but not one thing was special about it.  I think it is because so many people are addicted to sugar and their pizza crust was overly sweet.  Nothing special about their pizza offerings.  Their salads are a meh and too salty.   My husband also needs gluten free so this is one reason why we chose this place.  Well they did not happen to have it that day and the waiter treated us like we were pains.  He doesn't seem to keen on giving us other options on their menu.  So hubby goes for fish tacos and they are fried...so much for that.   The waiter is the main reason why I give it a one star.  Ahole. get another job

Well HUZZAH! We in Albuquerque are finally lucky enough to get our own CPK. Where else can you get a dose of LA-Yuppie-Chic, Goat cheese, and see the latest BMW has to offer all for less than $20?  Here at the ABQ-Q-CPK I really do enjoy the attentive service I get. The staff is attentive, not overbearing, and they do a good job of rotating customers through the restaurant without making us feel rushed. The food is reasonably good, and you might have to come here a few times before you finally get a Pizza combination that makes you happier than a 50's enthusiast at a Marilyn Manroe Look-Alike Poodle Skirt Dance off competition. On a sad note, the restaurant seems to be completely devoid of any sort of deep dish diet-busting  cheesy-calorie-fest Sicilian or Chicago style pie that the name suggests they might carry. But don't let that scare you away. The real secret here is the soups. They are all absolutely knock your socks off. Try the chicken tortilla. That soup will heal the sick and quickly make you forget pizza is supposed to have Marinara and toppings you personally dictate, and should be thicker than your iphone. As suggestions for improvement: I think the wait time on the Pizzas is slightly excessive, even with ordered appetizers. I would hope that the restaurant would offer some bread to nosh on or perhaps some sliced Parmesan cheese as a pallet cleanser before the meal. Either of those things would be awesome with the wines that are served. A $25 combo pack with soup, a single pizza, a shared salad and two soft drinks as a date special would be awesome. I'd come here more often with that deal.

Nice modern atmosphere. Generally always busy. Usually a 15 to 30 minute wait. If you are 1 or 2 people often there is immediate seating at the bar. Good appetizers, salads, and pizza. Not bad for a chain outfit. Staff and management are responsive and seem to aim to please.

The pizza is ok, but that could be that I was already full from huge salad.  try the salad with the peaches.  We got a full order of salad and 2 pizza. A meat lover with pepperoni and sausage (I like dion better) and the California club (topped with lettuce, tomato, and avocado). The mango tea was very sweet, it tasted better after I watered it down.

This is usually the only place I like to eat at when I'm in town--and its been this way for the past two years. I'm not a fan of finding hair in my food (go, figure), and it seems every other place seems to think that hair is part of the platter  (oh, Elephant Bar is okay too though- no hair in food there). While, again, I'm not a huge fan of chain restaurants, I do love their BBQ salad- and I love that they will accommodate me with no dressing, no avocado, yet tons of extra veggies. I appreciate the curbside pick up--after long travel/work days, the last thing I want to do is sit in a noisy restaurant, or find parking, walk in, wait for 20 min, etc. You get the idea.  Oh, I love that they will steam my broccolini without any butter too. LOL.
Great selection. The bbq chicken pizza with pineapple is amazing. The italian meat pizza is really good too. Good service and atmosphere. Will be going back, tons more pizzas I want to try.

I'm sayin' 5 Star because our dinner was awesome last night! Wild Mushroom Pizza w/ Truffle Oil = YUM!  And my Carnitas Tacos were SPICY, and filled with an ample sample of roasted pork. my only 2nd hand wish, would be to have a choice for a crispy, corn taco, instead of the soft, flour one. No biggy!  The food here is great, and the service friendly & expedient. I'll be back for MORE!
They ran out of key lime pie on their Valentine's day special. No substitutions to keep happy customers.

Normally this place is very consistent with food and service. Not tonight. The adobo margarita was so weak! Mostly sour mix and chipotle adobo sauce. The salads took about 35 minutes with the restaurant mostly empty. Then a server comes right in the middle of our meal and wants to take away the salt, pepper, Parmesan and red pepper shakers so she (Marti) can do her side work. Please, interrupt my dinner so you can make your life easier. Listen, customer service should be about the guest and not what makes it easy for the staff. Too many restaurants operate one what is good and easy for them and not what is best for the guest. California Pizza Kitchen has become nothing more than a big chain with less focus on the guest and that is sad, I always had thought they were better than that.
This place was awesome!  Had advocado rolls and the fish tacos. All the food was amazing and the service was outstanding. Salsa made all of it better. Not hot but had great smoky flavor!

I came during the lunch rush and I ordered to go and the way you order is by going up to the bar and trying to get the bartender to notice you for 10mins and then have a rude bartender ask what you would like in a rude manner and just stand there for 20 minutes waiting on your food, so yeah I would go there if you want to wait for 30 minutes for a take out order and some shitty pizza

This is one of my favorite pizza places in Albuquerque, they never disappoint. Me and my family go there on a regular basis and the service and food are always excellent. Our most recent visit was on a Saturday night, they we're slammed and we had a party of six. We were sat right away, even though there seemed to be a wait. Our server (Darcel) was on point, very warm and friendly even to the four rowdy kids we had with us. She constantly checked on us and brought us whatever we wanted without hesitation even though she was very busy. The food was outstanding as always they never disappoint there, came out hot and delicious. We even order dessert which was amazing, and the management frequently checked on us to make sure everything was great. Me and my husband were actually able to relax even though we had kids with us, who would have thought.

CPK was good. The environment was nice and the hostess was the nicest person! The waiter was great at his job and knew the menu well! I had the Habanero Pizza which I was warned about by the menu and the waiter, both warned about its spicy tendency. Both the menu and the waiter must be from California because it wasn't spicy at all. Just because I am a spiceaholic of sorts I was disappointed because the habanero pepper has deadly and memorable potential. Overall it was a good experience and seems like it would be a nice place to take a date.
Great food, atmosphere, and service.  Love the gluten free Waldorf chicken salad (full size), dressing on the side.

This review is for the carry out. They completely f'ed up the order, shorted us our order of 2 appetizers, and one of the three pizzas they put ham on instead of chicken. We picked it up on time, but it was still kinda cold. Pizza kinda meh. They did comp a desert , and I used to really love this place, good place to sit and eat in uptown, so mediated to 2 stars. Just had a really bad experience tonight. Carry out teenager was arrogant and rude to my wife when she did the second pickup, but manager made things a little better. Clean up your carry out cpk!
I love it here the food is always outstanding and the staff is always so friendly. As long as they keep this up, I'll be a loyal customer.
Five star service We love Peter Pizza dough app is the bomb got three small plate immediately!!!

Tonight for dinner I asked my mom where should would like to go, we usually go local but we were in the uptown area so I said why not CPK. I have gluten allergy so we have to be careful of where  we eat. It was not busy we got seated right a way. Our server knew all about the menu and what was gluten free and was knowledge about how they and where they cook it in the kitchen. Also the manager came to our table letting us know that there wouldn't be any cross contimination. Because of their great service and food allergy knowledge, it turned our dinner into a returning customer.
I really enjoyed this place. Service was good and the food was delicious. Pizza is great, my favorite is the Hawaiian. Super tasty!
Hatch was our waitress and she was AMAZING!! Super sweet and on her stuff. The food was amazing! By far the best potato soup I've ever had!

CPK is what the regulars refer to California Pizza Kitchen. This is a fun and modern-casual place where you can take everyone to co-workers, family, friends or well anyone. It's not too loud, the service is great. Fair beer selection, great varieties of pizza (thin and hand tossed).  Decent price range for everyone. It's also settled in the middle of uptown shopping center. So either take a break or finish shopping and grab a bite. You won't be let down.

I went here twice while on a vacation trip.  It is a really good CPK.  The pizza is good and the servers are wonderful.  I should mention we usually don't eat at CPK, but this location was in a convenient place and we were happy with our meals.

Went on a Friday night, wait still wasn't to bad , friendly staff, and the mushroom pizza with the truffle oil was fantastic ! Cocktails were yummy as well. Party of 4 and all our pizza was fantastic ! Def recommended this place.

Worst, most overpriced pizza ever.  We went in for dinner about 5pm.   there was only 2  tables in the whole place, but yet they took us all the way t the back around the corner out of sight from anyone.  Basically in the bathroom. When food finally came out, the salads were so small and pizza crust was soggy, we ended up just wanting to leave.  Unfortunately since they had sat us so far out of the way no one even remembered we were there. We will never be back.  We told them about how bad it was and didn't even eat 1/3 of everything. No manager ever came over and no discount taken.  NEVER again!!!

It may be a chain but I think the food is great and the location isn't half bad either!! I've tried several pizzas (including the carnitas/habanero pizza--my fave!). Their salads are tasty, the tortilla soup is great on a chilly day or if you're in the mood for a lighter bite, and the salads are good too. You can't really go wrong--the menu is ginormous. I also appreciate that they have Marble IPA on tap now as well. Solid place to eat!

I met a party of 6 here for a dear friends birthday after work. I arrived just as they were being served their food the waitress from promptly took my order for food and the  drink was out in less than a minute. Within seven minutes I was eating pizza along with my friends! All I can say is that was a great experience. I will pay whatever for that kind of customer service! I didn't bat a lash when the bill came I simply said keep the change! Great job!

We stopped in at CPK to take advantage of their generosity towards veterans on Veteran's Day.  The grilled chicken and garlic pizza was amazing.  I splashed on some of CPK's fresh habanero salsa for an extra kick.  The house was fairly busy for a Monday morning, and a lot of the clientele were veterans.  Devin did a great job, attending all of his tables with speed and professionalism.  He seemed genuinely grateful for all that veterans have gone through, which was nice to hear.
Ravioli, hummus, and salads rock solid. Fish tacos good in the belly. Good service but expect to wait for lunch.

Well this was a first. We were seated promptly but didn't see a waiter. Ever. No drink orders nothing. After 10 minutes we got up and walked out of the nearly empty restaurant to have the air headed hostess thank us for coming and hope we enjoyed ourselves. No we didn't

The food is good and we will be back.  BUT we had to wait over a hour and 15 minutes for a group of 12 to be seated at a mid-week lunch.  I normally understand about waits on large groups, hiowever, the past three times we ahve been herethe wait is always long.  The food is good but not that good that you should wait that long.

Pizza and salad.  That's all we wanted for dinner.  Sounds simple enough, right?   Wrong. Skip this place.  There is a total disregard for customer service at this location.  Coming from California, this CPK restaurant does not live up to its reputation.  There was no wait for us to be seated since we had dinner at 5pm.  There weren't many customers at that time, yet our waiter had flagrant disregard to the simple rules of good customer service.  Our simple order of pizza and salad took 40 minutes to get to our table, and the waiter offered no updates or compensation for the wait.  According to their new company policy (or maybe it's just at this location), they don't offer you their sourdough bread unless YOU ask for it.  Long story short, there are much better restaurants that will serve you better pizza and salad, where your dinner won't be ruined by crappy service.

The meal last night was definitely 5 stars. I can't imagine anything that could have made it better. There was no wait and the hostess and our waitress were both very nice.  I had the Moroccan Chicken Salad with spiced butternut squash, beets, avocado, dates, carrots, almonds, egg and dried cranberries. It also had super tender flavorful chicken and it was all tossed in a champagne vinaigrette. Total win.  My friend had the Asparagus & Spinach Spaghettini with Shrimp. I had a bite and it was really good. Garlicy, oily and comforting.  We had dessert also. The waitress thought we were cute because we had the menu propped up so we could both see it and we were evaluating each option like it was something really important.  I had the Chocolate Banana Royale Cake. The cake was perfectly moist (sorry if you're offended by this word. Apparently there are a lot of you.) and that is rare. I'm not quite sure why it's so hard for restaurants to make a moist (sorry) cake, even bakeries and cupcakeries seem to have a hard time with this. CPK managed it perfectly. So combine the perfectly moist (sorry. last time, i promise) dark chocolate cake with banana cream, chocolate mousse and chocolate frosting and you've got yourself a reason to show up at CPK every single night to sit at the bar alone and eat chocolate cake and wonder how many months or years it will take before one barstool just isn't enough for your growing bottom. Sigh.  But maybe I'm wrong and you should listen to the other reviewers and not go there because there's a chance that you might have to wait or someone might be rude to you. Then again this could be my way of ensuring that I never have to wait for my seat (or two) at the bar.

I know that it is weird for me to eat at CPK for my first meal in ABQ, especially coming from CA, but that is where I went.  It was really good. The carne asada pizza has always been a favorite, and it was just as good here. My gf got the chicken club, and enjoyed it quite a bit. The service was great. The restaurant was very busy, but clean.

The pizza's here are lack luster. We also ordered the Mediterranean appetizer that was gross, the humus was runny and the 3 pieces of pita that came with it were stone cold. It had been years since I'd eaten here and now I remember why.
UGH! disappointment. The pizza and sandwiches are gross... they try way too hard. If you want good pizza in Albuquerque, skip this place, go to Il Vicino.

We create our own salad out of 3 different ones and they do it for us, no problem. I would never eat a pizza from this fru-fru, shi-shi place but sharing a  salad withe the GF is a great way to spend a weekend lunch.  Get the half salad since its a couple dollars cheaper and it is exactly 2 servings unless your a hungry fata$$.
Always great service and great food. You can't really go wrong with CPK.

Fabulous pizza, fabulous service! The food is always delicious and always arrives quickly, even when we have large groups. The servers are very friendly and don't ever mind discussing the menu if you have any questions. If you can handle the nightmarish parking lot at Uptown, I definitely recommend!

I'm from out of town and I came to this restaurant with family and friends. We were told it would be a 45 minute wait. We waited for almost 2 hours and watched people who arrived after us be seated. We repeatedly went in and politely asked how long it would be and were told we would be next. When we finally said we were leaving because the wait was ridiculous and no body had once apologized, the hostess rudely said ok night. I even saw and heard other customers complaining about the service they were receiving or rather weren't receiving. The employees need to be trained in dealing with customers and etiquette. I'm very disappointed. And I will not be going back.
First time to CPK. Had The BBQ pizza and it was fantastic. Service was great.  Would definitely come again next time in Alburqurque.

Every time I come to this restaurant I leave full and happy. I tried a new menu item today the Avocado Egg Rolls and they where fantastic! The salad I ordered was the California Cobb while it was higher in price then most it had bacon and egg and tons of Avocado. My mother and brother got the Fish Tacos and seemed to like them however you only get two in the order. Our server was amazing and our food was delivered by the kitchen manager who was very happy to make sure we where taken care off. They also allowed me to use my coupon from facebook even though I forgot it.

A friend introduced this to me today and I was impressed. Wait staff was helpful, attentive and unpushy, the pizza was as thin as it could possibly be, (we ordered a thin crust Spinach Artichoke) and the cob salad was delicious and fresh. I have no complaint, I loved the meal. We make a pretty awesome thin crust pizza from scratch at our house that is so good I stopped getting pizza out, but this is worth the trip and I will definitely go there again.

There is always a wait here if you go at peak hours but it's worth the wait.  I've never ordered anything I didn't enjoy...the restaurant is clean, staff is friendly, menu has a lot of variety, and the portions are generous.  Ask for Devin if you go there...he's one of the best waiters I've encountered in Albuquerque!  Personable, attentitive, and makes a perfect Arnold Palmer!

Nice atmosphere, surrounded by stores, near another mall, great customer service and reasonably priced. Plus if you go during warm weather there's a fountain that children (and adults) can run through!

I got absolutely nothing against the pizza at CPK--they're pretty tasty and all--but they're NOT worth the wait you're gonna find at this location.  There are plenty of other decent pizza options around that have everything but the far-too-trendy name on the marquee.  It's probably a victim of its own success and maybe things would get better if other CPKs open in the area, but as things are now I don't see myself going back anytime soon.  The wait to get in was long and things took plenty of time once we were seated, too.  The staff was nice enough, but there were just TOO MANY PEOPLE trying to go.  Whatever.
